SEARCH
Package Screen

Class InventoryScreen

java.lang.Object
Screen.Screen
Screen.InventoryScreen
All Implemented Interfaces:
jay.jaysound.JayLayerListener
public class InventoryScreen extends Screen
A screen where the tools of player is displayed The player can see and equip tools by clicking on the tool the mouse hovered over

  • Field Summary

    BOMB, CHEST, MINE, PLAYER_APPEAR, SCREEN_HEIGHT, SCREEN_WIDTH, TAP

    Remembers the index of the screen that led to InventoryScreen so that when the player clicks the BackButton, it will direct the player back to the right screen

    Draws the InventoryScreen to the drawing surface and also the tools that the player found on the to drawing surface Also shows the tool information when the mouse goes to the tool

  • Constructor Details

    • InventoryScreen

      public InventoryScreen(DrawingSurface surface, Gambledorf player, StatsScreen stats)
      Creates an InventoryScreen objects
      Parameters:
      surface - A surface that allows the InventoryScreen to be drawn to
      player - The character that is drawn onto the screen, shared among all classes
      stats - A StatsScreen object that is shared among classes

  • Method Details

    • draw

      public void draw()
      Draws the InventoryScreen to the drawing surface and also the tools that the player found on the to drawing surface Also shows the tool information when the mouse goes to the tool
      Overrides:
      draw in class Screen

    • setup

      public void setup()
      Sets up the unique features of all the tools: sets their look and properties
      Overrides:
      setup in class Screen

    • mousePressed

      public void mousePressed()
      Detects mouse activity and act according to where the mouse clicked. Sets the character's current tool when the player clicked on a tool
      Overrides:
      mousePressed in class Screen

    • changeLastScreen

      public static void changeLastScreen(int screen)
      Remembers the index of the screen that led to InventoryScreen so that when the player clicks the BackButton, it will direct the player back to the right screen
      Parameters:
      screen - The index of the screen in the screen arraylist that exist within the DrawingSurface

    • addToInventory

      public static void addToInventory(Equipment input)
      Adds an equipment to the list of equipments that the player found
      Parameters:
      input - The new equipment that the player found and is to be added to the list
